snippet: The 2008 conviction of a Long Island man was thrown out after defense lawyers found evidence that refuted a key portion of the prosecution’s case.
abstract: Federal Judge Arthur D Spatt throws out conviction of Thomas F Green, Long Island man found guilty in 2008 of molesting his granddaughter and two of her friends; rules Green, who remains in prison, was deprived of a fair trial because of ineffective assistance by his lawyer at the time; new defense lawyers made discoveries that upended one victim's allegations.
lead_paragraph: The 2008 conviction of a Long Island man was thrown out after defense lawyers found evidence that refuted a key portion of the prosecution’s case.

headline.main: Man Granted New Trial in Child Sexual Abuse Case
headline.print_headline: Man Granted New Trial In Child Sexual Abuse Case
